org.zaproxy.zap.network

Interface HttpRedirectionValidator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultHttpRedirectionValidator

    public interface HttpRedirectionValidator
    A validator of redirections, called for each redirection of a HTTP request.

    As convenience the validator will also be notified of the HTTP messages sent and received (first message and followed redirections, if any).

    Since:
    2.6.0

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean isValid(org.apache.commons.httpclient.URI redirection)
      Tells whether or not the given redirection is valid, to be followed.
      void notifyMessageReceived(HttpMessage message)
      Notifies that a new message was sent and received (called for the first message and followed redirections, if any).

    • Method Detail

      • isValid

        boolean isValid(org.apache.commons.httpclient.URI redirection)
        Tells whether or not the given redirection is valid, to be followed.
        Parameters:
        redirection - the redirection being checked, never null.
        Returns:
        true if the redirection is valid, false otherwise.

      • notifyMessageReceived

        void notifyMessageReceived(HttpMessage message)
        Notifies that a new message was sent and received (called for the first message and followed redirections, if any).
        Parameters:
        message - the HTTP message that was received, never null.
